titleStmt.title: J. W. Morgan to James F. Robinson
CWG7663

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Military Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Covington Kentucky
Aug. 20. 1862
His Excellency Gov. Robinson
Dear Sir:

Dr R. A. Edwards of Walton, Boone County Kentucky, visits Frankfort, with a desire to join the military service of the Country. Dr Edwards has from the beginning of this crisis been a firm friend of the Government of the United States.

With G. Rept. Your
Obt. Servt.
J. W. Menzies

J. W. Menzes
recom for surgeon
